page.title: 07Local customs in St. Agnes
page.content: The inhabitants of St. Agnes still keep the Feast Day held as a feast of dedication of the Church. Originally it was declared a holiday, but this is not so today. Feast Monday is the Monday nearest to the 21st January; and each day of this week the Church organises some form of entertainment - mostly in the evenings. Also traditional is the Midsummer Bonfire, held on St. Agnes Beacon. This is one of a chain of fires throughout the County; and is now organised by the Old Cornwall Society. The Victorian Fayre, revived in Jubilee Year, is held on the May Bank Holiday (the old Whit Monday). Stalls are erected in the main street and the square (which are closed to traffic); and entertainment is provided by the St. Agnes Silver band, clog dancers, buskers, and a travelling jester.
